Module kivakit.data.compression
Package com.telenav.kivakit.data.compression.codecs.huffman

Class HuffmanCodec<Symbol>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.data.compression.codecs.huffman.HuffmanCodec<Symbol>
  • Type Parameters:
    Symbol - The symbol value type to compress and decompress, for example Character or String
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Codec<Symbol>
    public class HuffmanCodec<Symbol>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Codec<Symbol>
    A general-purpose Huffman coder implementing Codec which works for any arbitrary symbol type. This design allows for both characters and strings to be Huffman-coded, which is useful when compressing tags because certain key and value strings occur very frequently. Table-based Huffman decoding of symbols from ByteList input is implemented with FastHuffmanDecoder.

    A codec can be constructed with from(Symbols, Maximum), passing in the symbols to be used and the maximum number of bits for the longest allowable Huffman code. The toString() method returns a useful representation of codes and their bit patterns.

    Once the codec has been constructed, it can be used like any other Codec, by calling Codec.encode(ByteList, SymbolProducer) to encode a series of values and Codec.decode(ByteList, SymbolConsumer) to decode values from a byte array.

    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
    See Also:
    ByteList, SymbolConsumer, SymbolProducer, FastHuffmanDecoder, Huffman Coding, Fast Huffman Decoding

      • from

        public static <Symbol> HuffmanCodec<Symbol> from​(Symbols<Symbol> symbols,
                                                 Maximum bits)
        Returns:
        A Huffman codec for the given symbol frequencies and escape symbol where no code is longer than the given number of bits. Only symbols that have at least the given number of occurrences are included.
